verses.text: And Abimelech the son of Jerubbaal went to Shechem unto his mother’s brethren , and communed with them, and with all the family of the house of his mother’s father , saying ,

Speak , I pray you, in the ears of all the men of Shechem , Whether \add is\add* better for you, either that all the sons of Jerubbaal , \add which are\add* threescore and ten persons , reign over you, or that one reign over you? remember also that I \add am\add* your bone and your flesh.\f + \fr 9.2 \ft Whether…: Heb. What is good? whether, etc\f*

And his mother’s brethren spake of him in the ears of all the men of Shechem all these words : and their hearts inclined to follow Abimelech ; for they said , He \add is\add* our brother.\f + \fr 9.3 \ft to follow: Heb. after\f*
And they gave him threescore and ten \add pieces\add* of silver out of the house of Baal-berith , wherewith Abimelech hired vain and light persons , which followed him.

And he went unto his father’s house at Ophrah , and slew his brethren the sons of Jerubbaal , \add being\add* threescore and ten persons , upon one stone : notwithstanding yet Jotham the youngest son of Jerubbaal was left ; for he hid himself.

And all the men of Shechem gathered together , and all the house of Millo , and went , and made Abimelech king , by the plain of the pillar that \add was\add* in Shechem.\f + \fr 9.6 \ft plain: or, oak\f* \p

¶ And when they told \add it\add* to Jotham , he went and stood in the top of mount Gerizim , and lifted up his voice , and cried , and said unto them, Hearken unto me, ye men of Shechem , that God may hearken unto you.
The trees went forth \add on a time\add* to anoint a king over them; and they said unto the olive tree , Reign thou over us.

But the olive tree said unto them, Should I leave my fatness , wherewith by me they honour God and man , and go to be promoted over the trees ?\f + \fr 9.9 \ft go…: or, go up and down for other trees\f*
And the trees said to the fig tree , Come thou, \add and\add* reign over us.
But the fig tree said unto them, Should I forsake my sweetness , and my good fruit , and go to be promoted over the trees ?
Then said the trees unto the vine , Come thou, \add and\add* reign over us.
And the vine said unto them, Should I leave my wine , which cheereth God and man , and go to be promoted over the trees ?
Then said all the trees unto the bramble , Come thou, \add and\add* reign over us.\f + \fr 9.14 \ft bramble: or, thistle\f*

And the bramble said unto the trees , If in truth ye anoint me king over you, \add then\add* come \add and\add* put your trust in my shadow : and if not, let fire come out of the bramble , and devour the cedars of Lebanon.

Now therefore, if ye have done truly and sincerely , in that ye have made Abimelech king , and if ye have dealt well with Jerubbaal and his house , and have done unto him according to the deserving of his hands ;
(For my father fought for you, and adventured his life far , and delivered you out of the hand of Midian :\f + \fr 9.17 \ft adventured…: Heb. cast his life\f*

And ye are risen up against my father’s house this day , and have slain his sons , threescore and ten persons , upon one stone , and have made Abimelech , the son of his maidservant , king over the men of Shechem , because he \add is\add* your brother ;)
If ye then have dealt truly and sincerely with Jerubbaal and with his house this day , \add then\add* rejoice ye in Abimelech , and let him also rejoice in you:

But if not, let fire come out from Abimelech , and devour the men of Shechem , and the house of Millo ; and let fire come out from the men of Shechem , and from the house of Millo , and devour Abimelech.
And Jotham ran away , and fled , and went to Beer , and dwelt there, for fear of Abimelech his brother. \p
¶ When Abimelech had reigned three years over Israel ,
Then God sent an evil spirit between Abimelech and the men of Shechem ; and the men of Shechem dealt treacherously with Abimelech :

That the cruelty \add done\add* to the threescore and ten sons of Jerubbaal might come , and their blood be laid upon Abimelech their brother , which slew them; and upon the men of Shechem , which aided him in the killing of his brethren.\f + \fr 9.24 \ft aided…: Heb. strengthened his hands to kill\f*
And the men of Shechem set liers in wait for him in the top of the mountains , and they robbed all that came along that way by them: and it was told Abimelech.
And Gaal the son of Ebed came with his brethren , and went over to Shechem : and the men of Shechem put their confidence in him.

And they went out into the fields , and gathered their vineyards , and trode \add the grapes\add*, and made merry , and went into the house of their god , and did eat and drink , and cursed Abimelech.\f + \fr 9.27 \ft merry: or, songs\f*

And Gaal the son of Ebed said , Who \add is\add* Abimelech , and who \add is\add* Shechem , that we should serve him? \add is\add* not \add he\add* the son of Jerubbaal ? and Zebul his officer ? serve the men of Hamor the father of Shechem : for why should we serve him?
And would to God this people were under my hand ! then would I remove Abimelech. And he said to Abimelech , Increase thine army , and come out. \p
¶ And when Zebul the ruler of the city heard the words of Gaal the son of Ebed , his anger was kindled.\f + \fr 9.30 \ft kindled: or, hot\f*

And he sent messengers unto Abimelech privily , saying , Behold, Gaal the son of Ebed and his brethren be come to Shechem ; and, behold, they fortify the city against thee.\f + \fr 9.31 \ft privily: Heb. craftily or, to Tormah\f*
Now therefore up by night , thou and the people that \add is\add* with thee, and lie in wait in the field :

And it shall be, \add that\add* in the morning , as soon as the sun is up , thou shalt rise early , and set upon the city : and, behold, \add when\add* he and the people that \add is\add* with him come out against thee, then mayest thou do to them as thou shalt find occasion.\f + \fr 9.33 \ft as thou shalt…: Heb. as thine hand shall find\f* \p
¶ And Abimelech rose up , and all the people that \add were\add* with him, by night , and they laid wait against Shechem in four companies.
And Gaal the son of Ebed went out , and stood in the entering of the gate of the city : and Abimelech rose up , and the people that \add were\add* with him, from lying in wait.

And when Gaal saw the people , he said to Zebul , Behold, there come people down from the top of the mountains. And Zebul said unto him, Thou seest the shadow of the mountains as \add if they were\add* men.

And Gaal spake again and said , See there come people down by the middle of the land , and another company come along by the plain of Meonenim.\f + \fr 9.37 \ft middle: Heb. navel\f*\f + \fr 9.37 \ft Meonenim: or, the regarders of times\f*

Then said Zebul unto him, Where \add is\add* now thy mouth , wherewith thou saidst , Who \add is\add* Abimelech , that we should serve him? \add is\add* not this the people that thou hast despised ? go out , I pray now , and fight with them.
And Gaal went out before the men of Shechem , and fought with Abimelech.
And Abimelech chased him, and he fled before him, and many were overthrown \add and\add* wounded , \add even\add* unto the entering of the gate.
And Abimelech dwelt at Arumah : and Zebul thrust out Gaal and his brethren , that they should not dwell in Shechem.
And it came to pass on the morrow , that the people went out into the field ; and they told Abimelech.

And he took the people , and divided them into three companies , and laid wait in the field , and looked , and, behold, the people \add were\add* come forth out of the city ; and he rose up against them, and smote them.

And Abimelech , and the company that \add was\add* with him, rushed forward , and stood in the entering of the gate of the city : and the two \add other\add* companies ran upon all \add the people\add* that \add were\add* in the fields , and slew them.
And Abimelech fought against the city all that day ; and he took the city , and slew the people that \add was\add* therein, and beat down the city , and sowed it with salt. \p
¶ And when all the men of the tower of Shechem heard \add that\add*, they entered into an hold of the house of the god Berith.
And it was told Abimelech , that all the men of the tower of Shechem were gathered together.

And Abimelech gat him up to mount Zalmon , he and all the people that \add were\add* with him; and Abimelech took an axe in his hand , and cut down a bough from the trees , and took it, and laid \add it\add* on his shoulder , and said unto the people that \add were\add* with him, What ye have seen me do , make haste , \add and\add* do as I \add have done\add*.\f + \fr 9.48 \ft me do: Heb. I have done\f*

And all the people likewise cut down every man his bough , and followed Abimelech , and put \add them\add* to the hold , and set the hold on fire upon them; so that all the men of the tower of Shechem died also, about a thousand men and women. \p
¶ Then went Abimelech to Thebez , and encamped against Thebez , and took it.
But there was a strong tower within the city , and thither fled all the men and women , and all they of the city , and shut \add it\add* to them, and gat them up to the top of the tower.
And Abimelech came unto the tower , and fought against it, and went hard unto the door of the tower to burn it with fire.
And a certain woman cast a piece of a millstone upon Abimelech’s head , and all to brake his skull.

Then he called hastily unto the young man his armourbearer , and said unto him, Draw thy sword , and slay me, that men say not of me, A woman slew him. And his young man thrust him through , and he died.
And when the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead , they departed every man unto his place. \p
¶ Thus God rendered the wickedness of Abimelech , which he did unto his father , in slaying his seventy brethren :
And all the evil of the men of Shechem did God render upon their heads : and upon them came the curse of Jotham the son of Jerubbaal.
